intro: Galium × ochroleucum var. decolorans, commonly known as the pale yellow bedstraw, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variant is known for its variable coloration, with some individuals showing a reduction in pigmentation. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
